Quickstride gets the shuttle airbourne and sets the course for the tower.  =
He tries to lock in on an Autobot signature, and gets Rat Trap's readilly.
=

"Sir, I've locked in on Rat Trap's signature.... And yes, I do see a faint=
 but very faint Autobot signature...  It's a bit weaker than normal... Whic=
h  Oh wow, sir, that Autobot seems to be using a backup battery... Not good=
...  Because when he loses that he's done for."

Back at the fortress, Rat =
Trap scrambles to try to evade the fire, and now realizes that things are f=
ar out of hand.  He finds himself flushed out of his hiding place, and corn=
ered at the entrance of the vent cover.

"Gahhh!  So much for evasive maneu=
vers!  RAT TRAP MAXIMIZE!"

He gets into robot mode and slides down, landin=
g behind Tucson.  Tucson turns his head after hearing him land on his tiny =
feet.

"Rat Trap?"

Rat Trap looks up.

"Sorry Wheels, cover got blown.  Th=
e pipes are crawln' with spider bots and the base's defenses are on high al=
ert.  I managed ta kinda do some damage to the electrical system but not mu=
ch. Oh slag...  I - see why you're not movn'."

He looks up to Rodimus.

Tu=
cson stands idol and then realizes that his backup battery is being drained=
 rather quickly. He could also hear Darkhawk behind him.

"I'm down to eigh=
ty percent in my backup battery, not enough to fight, just enough for an es=
cape, Rodimus is blocking my way and that pest of a predicon is beginning t=
o really annoy me."

Rat Trap desperately open fires on the auto guns and d=
roids.

"So what's the plan wheels?!"

Tucson sighs he would have to abando=
n his plight for the time being.  Something inside him was telling him that=
 his escape now was more important than trying to do everything at one time=
.  

"Sometimes Rat Trap, we don't always have the answers to everything.  =
And right now, I have no answer for you.  I want you to get yourself out of=
 here.. Now."

Rat Trap gasps.  He gives Tucson back the transmitter.

"But=
, but what about you wheels?  I can't leave ya here, he'll pulverize ya.  Y=
ou're just about the only pal I got left and I can't afford ta lose ya!"

T=
ucson stays put.

" Please, go! NOW!  FOR YOUR SAFTEY RAT TRAP, GET OUT OF =
HERE!"

Rat Trap doesn't budge.

"NO, IF YOU GO DOWN I GO WITH YA!  I AIN'T=
 GONNA ABANDON YA WHEELS, YOU DIDN'T ABANDON ME SO IT'S HIGH TIME I RETURN =
THE FAVOR!"

He didn't know how to react.  Rat Trap may be small but his he=
art was definitely in the right place.  If anything was going to help the b=
oth of them, it was this newly found friendship that they developed in just=
 a short amount of time.  He gently puts a hand on Rat Trap's head, and giv=
es it a gentile rub.

" Guess there's no changing your mind is there?"

Rat=
 Trap smiles up to him.

"We're in this tagether Wheels."  

Tucson's expre=
ssion changes as he now turns his attention to Rodimus.

" You mock us beca=
use you think we're inferior.  I beg to differ with you Rodimus.  Because i=
f you were as strong as you claim to be, you would not have fallen into suc=
h treachery.  There's something about this room you remember, it will alway=
s haunt you and not because of the pain it may have caused, but the guilt y=
ou will always feel, knowing that you did not have the will to fend off you=
r enemy when they overtook you.  I did look up to you at one time, I though=
t you were strong, resistant, and noble.  My views have all been altered no=
w.  I do not know what happened, perhaps one day I will understand, but now=
, I see the truth.  Truth is, you don't want to be helped, and you have tur=
ned your back on your faction.  Truth is, the only true leader of the Autob=
ots was Optimus Prime.  I'd do anything to see him back online once again. =
 You are not my leader anymore and you do not intimidate me.  If I fall I f=
all, but at least I know I did my best to honor Optimus Prime as he would h=
ave wanted me to.  No scrappling would ever have pledged his loyalty as Rat=
 Trap has today.  His heart is there, and it's more than I can say for you.=
"

Rat Trap freezes for a moment.  He had not expected Tucson to say what h=
e said.

"Wow, wheels ya really mean that?"

Tucson nodds.

"I do."

His ex=
pression turns stone cold.

" I intend to finish what I started, I will fin=
ish my mission, but after that, do not expect me to have the same amount of=
 respect for you when this is all over Rodimus.  But now, is not the time f=
or that.  I see that what I accomplished was just the first phase.  I've ac=
complished that thus far.  I've learned for myself what needs to be done, a=
nd what needs to be done can't be completed today.  That will have to wait.=
"

Rat Trap looks up.

"Wheels  we gotta move."

Tucson listens to Rat Trap=
 and transforms in front of Rodimus.  He opens his driver's side door and l=
ets him in.

" I believe this is where you step asside Rodimus, and let us =
pass."

He exclaims while shotting at a few more droids.

>   
> On wheels, Tucson had a better chance of m=
aneuvering between the blasts that Scorponok was throwing out. He uses his =
current state to his advantage, and screches his rubber on his tires, pivot=
ing them quickly to maneuver away from the blasts. He had no sonar senses t=
o guide him but he had his audo sensors and his sense of feel and touch, gu=
iding him. The system that Rat Trap was now holding merely augments his aud=
io sensors and even though he could have used the device, he was now quickl=
y getting used to not having it on him. And now, he could feel Rodimus's en=
ergy signature. But first he had to get rid of Scorponok and Dark Hawk. He =
knew he did not have enough energon in his main power core, but he did have=
 a reserve stash in his backup battery. He calculated that since he had har=
dly touched this backup, it had close to ninety five percent capacity, yet =
it had to be used sparingly. This meant deciding between vehicle and robot =
mode. He makes a quick anaylasis of his systems.. Which would be able to co=
ncerve more? Vehicle or robot mode? 
> 
> The truth was, they were equal in=
 ussage. But he knew he had to stick to vehicle mode, to make for a fast ge=
taway if he did indeed find a way out of there.. Meanwhile, hidden not too =
far now, from the torture chamber, Rat Trap who has made his way into a ven=
t hole, right over the chamber, spots Tucson. He then finds another bundle =
of wires and finds readable tags on them.
> 
> "It's wheels, he's up'n runn=
'n.. Must be on a backup battery... That might last a few hours but that's =
about it. Okay, time for this rat ta be his rattiest!" 
> 
> He finds a tag=
 that leads to the chamber, and begins to knaw at the wires that are connec=
ted to it. He snaps them readilly with his strong, buck teeth. The doors su=
ddenly open in the torture chamber.
> 
> "WHEELS, BURN RUBBER!"
> 
> Tucson=
 could hear Rat Trap's voice and without questioning him, he spins his rear=
 tires, creates a smoke screen and senses the wind coming in from the open =
doors. He takes this opportunity to get past Scorponok, via creating a low =
lying smoke cloud, cloaking his chassse, and manges to get outside the cham=
ber, stopping in front of Rodimus. Rat Trap continues to knaw at wires, hop=
ing that one of them was another wire that would disable the security and w=
eaponry systems.
> 
> Outside, Tucson transforms into robot mode and in fro=
nt of Rodimus. This was it,he was face to face with his former leader. Rat =
Trap positions himself inside, at a peek hole, to watch what's happening.
>=
 
> "Lord Elder, you wont' believe this, but, Tucson got outa there, and he=
's face ta face with Rodimus. I sure hope he gives 'em his come uppn's. Lou=
sey worthless piece of Scrap.. I hope wheels drives you to the ground'n the=
n some... "
> 
> At the Ark and shuttle area...
> 
> Quickstride looks arou=
nd and focuses on the shuttle. Yet, the body of Optimus Prime holds his att=
ention for a moment as he looks up to him.
> 
> "Wow, you must've been one =
heck of a leader in your days. Rat Trap says he's with someone who's relate=
d to you. I wish I could do something ta help you guys get back on your whe=
els, but I'm just a Maximal and I really don't know how to bring your men b=
ack ta life... That Autobot out there could sure use your help, looks like =
that Rodimus guy really let you down and gave into those Predacons. I reall=
y can't judge the guy because I wasn't there when it happened, but from wha=
t Rat Trap says, I - dunno if I could ever respect a leader who weakens und=
er pressure. Okay, I gotta go, Lord Elder needs my help. Rest in peace.
> 
=
> He salutes the still form of Optimus Prime and gets to the shuttle. 
> 
>=
 "Lord Elder, I've reached the shuttle and I'm now performing preliminary t=
ake off proceedures."
>
